Posts.Content: Apr 1, 2011 09:09PM CameoBarbie wrote: I'm not sure how long you have been dealing with nipple retraction. I have about two years of a stimulated breast that is similar to sucking something sour and your whole mouth reacts - the sensation is like, that, it radiates), except the pain is in the breast,  Total nipple, and periorialar ,except it is underneath the nipple if you know what I mean.   In the last two days I've expressed discharge from my nipple (left) from one spot only and of course, because I didn't think of it before, only when I pull on it to see if there is a fluid discharge. It initially started  out with a brown, rusty color but now it is dark green.  Have an appointment Monday, to see if it is going to be checked out or not. ANYTHING should be brought to your Doc's attention.

Posts.Content: Nov 22, 2010 10:04AM CameoBarbie wrote: I'm sorry.  I had to get nothing but sleep this weekend.  I've had this in my mind for so long that I can only assume this is what is causing my problems. I had a biopsy in 08.   I was told it was just a cyst.  Having no other info, I came here.  I asked my Doc for more info and was flatly put down and told I have an anxiety disorder-take some drugs.  I refused.  I ran with it and had no one to talk to about things. A year later my retired Doc set me up with a BS and I spoke with her thinking it was a cyst.  She did not correct me nor inform me of the difference.  I stayed here to learn and realize just how much emotional effort this should occupy of my life.  She also sent me to a new radiology office where information as of June 09 at least is detailed. I guess along the way the lie or the brush off has effected me more and more.  Benign is benign but the difference is important to me.  A cyst - we've read about those.  A benign lipoma is a tumor.  So I say Hurray. I had a battery of tests done about 3 months ago - bone density, blood and heart, more chest xrays.  I went back to complain that my RB was really hurting and because of the tests she put me on really strong antibiotics. Said I had a low grade fever - where, I don't know.  That was three months ago and the pain only stopped about 3 weeks ago.  I asked if I could work through the pain as my job is physical, and yes I could. Easier said than done. Somehow, I since my June mam/us, I have become very aggitated.  The report itself had typo's and they at that office said no, I was given the correct one and their's doesn't have any typo's.  I don't want to ask my Doctor for a revised one, as she is not verbally helpful.  So I let it go.  That probably is contributing.  Had to go back for more results, and she said I was fine.  I exhaled and asked no questions and she said I needed to go on the antidepressants she has said I need for the last 2 years.  Since that appt  I have lost it 3 times but last week I was like watching someone else.  I was hysterical all night and I have not slept in a week and a half more than 3 hours a day.  So I vented here, made the appointment and am going on those drugs. I have the appt this afternoon.  I have an appt at work because I have been so unreliable since June.  I don't want to discuss this with them.

Posts.Content: CameoBarbie wrote: Okay folks.  I called for the follow-up appt with my PHP's office after a very informative and calming appt with the BS who I haven't seen in 2 years.  The office of my PHP said IF the Dr feels it's important , then an appt will be scheduled.  I lost it, and said NO there will be a follow up at which point they agreed to make an appt.  HUH?  Who's God? The PHP doesn't make my regular 6 month appts for ultra/mammo unless I remind them.  I am so angry.  It took alot to bring me down from the wait for the BS only to hear - our opinion is greater?  HUH.  Anybody else confused about parity in follow-up? Posts.Content: CameoBarbie wrote: Okay, in December will be us/mammo making it 2 years of every six months.  I had to fight for a copy of my very first report and get them now because of it.  I got ?#&t on for asking questions, brushed off for my questions, and told I was just fine.  Okay it took six months and another doctor to get me the first report and then she also got me appointments with a BS and the Center.  Not knowing anything I justified them because they are the Doctors. At that time I discussed things based on the info verbally said to me about cysts.  Fine, only that wasn't the truth. From what I have learned here, a cyst and a lipoma are two different benign objects. A cyst can be removed a few different ways - a lipoma excised. But a complex cyst ... Okay hurray.  But, why the freakin' games?  Nothing going on - just show up for these. So, in the last two years, I have had these fears hanging over me - it's like watching a car skid right at you, and then ?  What do I do with these thoughts?  I've changed my mind, I can't handle it anymore.  Give me drugs - so I, me, yeah Me, so I can be selective in what I hear.  I am so sick of not overexaggerating but what if,,, and no body to talk to about any of these fears.  If I overexaggerate, did I?  I don't know. I've exploded in the last three weeks, at least 4 times, this last time I came out of the panic heaving and just a basket case.  No one said anything to do it, no one to discuss it with, no one who understands the fear.  Yup. I'm done having my say. Can't handle it at the back of my mind as a whatif and even wondering if I should learn any more about the different diagnosises that could occur.  And if any lump is best in a jar, what if they won't take the rest of these idiotic things out? How come I have to justify their reasoning and ignore my own self?  (And she fades off, crying) Log in to post a reply

Posts.Content: Aug 25, 2009 09:11PM CameoBarbie wrote: Hi Trabby I too have something at 9 o'clock, something at 7 o'clock and did or do still at 1o'clock, plus some stuff the radiologist didn't know what they could be - shadowy. My Doctor said she works at the Cancer Center here with breast cancer people AND she said not to worry.  I haven't seen her yet this week, no appointment needed, just wait 2 hours, or wait over a week. When I had the mamo, the girl said to ask the radiologist for answers while I was there, instead of waiting. He recommended the MRI.  But, the other doctor who needle biopsied, then cut me, 3 weeks later, took out a lump I found, along with 2 others - that was back in October.  She said there were more there, but the freezing was wearing off, as I knew, while she stitched me back up. That was my 1 o'clock site.  But because she cut first, they were mad about not knowing where it grew from exactly.  It was as big as a marble, and upon taking it out, she said she knew ThaT one was a cyst. They were all sent for testing, and that's the info I forgot, and am going back to get, again, as the cyst was B9, as they are.  Don't remember what the other two were.  As for 7 and 9, that showed up in the mamo and the us, and that's what they're looking at, on me, AND, as well, because she cut, they have to wait for the scarring and tissue to heal, ONE year, and then they wait 6 months for new imaging.  That puts me off until December, or the new year. I trust my Doctor, but, as others have said, they don't want us going off the deep end in stress, which also doesn't help.   So, I'm along for the ride with you.
Posts.Title: Ultrasound ~ WOW Trabby CameoBarbie

Posts.Content: Sep 19, 2009 03:01PM CameoBarbie wrote: I;m okay.  The Doctor I was hoping to track down is now doing Diabetes research strictly.  I'm not diabetic and he's in Ontario. As for my neighbours, well, they had to find somewhere else, the fire and especially the water damage make the house unliveable as is.  Still don't know what started it, I missed all the news reports and everyone else around here can't be seen again. It was really windy too so I was concerned that it might spread.  Luckily the other neighbour's house is not as close on the lot as the rest of the houses around here. Someone said maybe the gas from the lawnmower under the back deck got hot enough, it was a record setting 30.7 degrees Celsius.  And yeah, she was home with 2 babies 4ish and younger, getting dinner ready for when hubby got home.  They had been trying to sell it for about 3 months now. And me, I am okay.  I decided to live like I don't have any problems until December. Actually the new year before they do anything, if anything anyway.  My husband and I bought a house in May, and I've been working on that, hopefully, some furniture gets over there this weekend.  The tenants were absolute pigs.  I have a JennAir stove, and I went WOW, and opened the oven and there was rotting food in it.  Tell, you, I have been scrubbing and scrubbing the place clean since we got it July 1. Maybe overcleaning but, hey, it was their mess.  Almost liveable now.  I'll let you know when I have to switch the cable over.  Oh, and I work nights, so that's why I'm either early morning or around supper time on here.  So, I guess I'm too busy. Trying not to wear myself out.  Looking for laughs.

Posts.Content: Aug 26, 2009 10:08PM CameoBarbie wrote: Hi Trabby & Everyone Well, saw the Doctor today to discuss Radiol'gst' report. She read it as I watched her read it.  I heard alot of bjlahlhah,page turn,blahblah,,,.  It isn't anything to worry about, she said.  I read over her shoulder alittle, it said lots of somethings at 1 AND 2 o'clock, due to the biopsy probably, then said 7,9 AND 11 o'clock. Words like, focal.  Birad on the cyst and "nodules" were a 3.  I asked where these growths came from, oh, breast tissue. Couldn`t see the treatment suugested, other than new imaging as planned for December. Then I hit her right between the eyes, about the ``link`` between Cysts and Synthroid.  She flatout said there isn`t one.  I said I had been researching my predicament on breastcancer.org, and that there is documentation, as well as Doctor studies, suggesting there is one, AS WELL AS, many people discussing it.    SHE  shut right up.  THEN YOU KNOW WHAT SHE DID - Started discussing my menopause, said I had an anxiety disorder, and wrote out a prescription for an Anti-Depressant !!!!!!!!!!!!!  Said I was acting out on those things that are real to me and not to anyone else, and that this would get me in trouble at work !!! I called the office back an hour after I got home, and requested a copy of the report again.  She ``does not want me to have one.`` Now what, I`m just crazy !!! I`m looking for another Doctor, who doesn`t beat me over the head for being concerned about myself and asking for answers. I am not taking these.

Posts.Content: Apr 6, 2011 07:44PM CameoBarbie wrote: Somebody said it exactly.  If the radiologist says it's nothing why does it all stop there instead of what we are saying.  Back in January, the radiologist said it was nothing.   Now it is March April for me.  My family Doc is sending me to a different office to do these "grams and sounds."  Second opinion or because she now has proof and the other place is "too busy?" Just a guess.  I was worried about the different machines and observers but maybe this place has an expert for this kind of thing. Mawhinney -  you have had a lot of things looked at and/or aspired or checked,  how come I have had to fight this far for things.  The first radiologist entered the room and said I had a fibroadenoma; never hearing of one, I was perplexed of course, but no where in my paperwork does it signify an actual "fibroadenoma."  When I was talking with someone else they said Dr's use "cysts" for a catch phrase for any believed benign something or another.  Well, a cyst doesn't contribute to forming tumors nor as "I" understand to breast cancer risk. "I" had a lipoma, rare in the breast, but a type of encapsulated benign tumor but that still is a tumor but has links to other genetic-type things. What should I think about a fibroadenoma diagnosis when it has never appeared in any report?  Did getting everything looked at cause alot of discord?  Did you have to ask for treatment of those? And from what I have being reading researching about nipple discharge, it is also relatively rare (10-15%)-  now I have produced two "rare" events.  HMMMM. Till tomorrow.

Posts.Content: Aug 23, 2010 01:43PM CameoBarbie wrote: I'm back.  I took the past six or so months away, from any thought of this and did me alot of good.  Researching behind the scenes though.  I just wanted to say that as before the thyroid issues I had for 7 years changed my whole body around. LEAF - I found out that what is active is the original Autom-immune Disorder that CAUSED the thyroid problems, is at work.  I just thought I'd mention that thyroid issues can be a secondary cause - this I was told to by the Hemotologist.  I didn't realize you also had thyroid issues way back.  I tested positive for something that is an auto-immune disorder first. I am glad everyone seems to be allowed to discuss other matters that worry us - any systemic problem that can be either ruled out or addressed as something to worry about.  Somebody really made me feel we were zoning out over nothing. I'm still not getting any information and brushed off regarding any questions I have over the lumpies I have, but am to be staying on 6 month ultrasounds and 1 year mammos. Go figure.

Posts.Content: Sep 17, 2009 09:50PM CameoBarbie wrote: Well that's it for this week.  Can't find the Doctor I was hoping to find. Left a message at the med center he is at now, but, no answer.  Doing Diabetes research instead. When I called here to say that I did not have time to get a referral from him for another Doctor, before he left, and that the reason I was looking for him was because of a possibility of breast cancer, the receptionist just repeated that he had moved.  NOT one bit of concern about what I had just said about me. So I repeated it and asked if there was any way of reaching him; no.  She didn't even ask me who I was nor consider asking if there was anything They could do.   So, my Husband remembered his childhood friend's sister is in cancer research here, somewhere, so we put a call in to her, but no reply yet.  I can't even find the Doctor who did the biopsy. So all this waiting has had me thinking about something else.  I don't understand the estrogen connection yet, other than it is bad to have too much.  Well, it is classified as a sex hormone, so why is this bad?????????????? Is this where like men we can't have too much of it because, in men's cases, they might have a heart attack?  And us, our boobs blow up?  Sorry not tonight Dear. Keep that pin away from me! Estrogen, Estrogen. My neighbour's house caught on fire yesterday, 2 houses down.  The back half of the house is a writeoff.  Pretty scary.  But it had me thinking, if we consider ourselves, isn't this whole thing about the same idea, I mean, how much damage do we sustain before it is under control? A whole team of firefighters, EMS, police, city electrical and natural gas people, the neighbour's - everyone was there.  Everyone there, allowing who is allowed to, to PUT the fire out.  Now, they're dealing with restoration, and insurance and loss prevention.  Yeah, it'll never be the same, but all the friends and consideration.  WOW.  I didn't know so many of my neighbours are home in the afternoon! Yeah, so I guess I'll play with fire for now and roll with the estrogen!
